Ted Strickland: a Democratic candidate for the U.S. Senate in Ohio, stated during a debate that Rob Portman called the auto rescue a "lousy deal" for Ohio.
Strickland: s campaign provided evidence of a 2009 statement from Portman, where he referred to the General Motors bankruptcy plan as a "lousy deal for Ohio" due to the closure of plants and loss of jobs.
The campaign also referred to a quote fr: s former spokesperson in 2011, stating that Portman still believed the auto bailout was not a good deal for Ohio.
Portman: s campaign argued that although he was not in office at the time of the bailout, he would have supported it and mentioned during a 2010 U.S. Senate debate that he would have liked to see more conditions in the bailout.
